The usually ordinary play told Carmelo Anthony everything he needed to know- his sprained left ankle was just fine. I figured if I could do that, I'm good, Carmelo Anthony said. from financial dealings with Ivory Coast until Gbagbo hands over power to Alassane Ouattara , the man internationally recognised as having won November's disputed election. With patience wearing thin, Alassane Ouattara said West African elite troops should act. If ECOWAS do send in special forces with the objective of removing Mr Gbagbo, he will be removed without much damage, he said. Alassane Ouattara was confident such action would not spark a civil war in Ivory Coast. He claims Gbagbo's mercenary militias are killing civilians daily.
